title: Proposal, encoding/xml: Allow for unmarshaling arbitrary local names with a given namespace via a glob
body:
Currently one can use a tag such as

```go
`xml:"localname"`
```

to unmarshal something with a given name, and an arbitrary namespace. However, it doesn't work the other way around (a known namespace and an arbitrary localname). It would be nice if there could be some kind of glob unmarshalling so that something like an XMPP error:

```xml
<defined-condition xmlns='urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:xmpp-stanzas'/>
<invalid-xml xmlns='urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:xmpp-stanzas'/>
```

could be unmarshaled via:

```go
`xml:"urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:xmpp-stanzas *"`
```
